Case reference: 2020008550.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1984, Anita Tamboom was seen for the last time by her neighbour in Toronto, Ontario. Anita was known to frequently leave her home for extended periods, but she would always return. During the time of her disappearance, Anita was suffering from some mental health issues, and her purse was located on the shores of Lake Ontario.

Case reference: 2010001399.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2009, Trevor Andrews was seen for the last time when he left a friend's house in a residential area of London, Ontario, intending to catch a bus to go home. He never returned home to his father's apartment. It cannot be confirmed that he got on the bus. Trevor is known to be very sociable. He would be noticed because of his energetic behaviour. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004348.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1998, Steven Mylan was last seen at his family residence in Mississauga Ontario.  It is believed that Steven might have been headed to New York, and or, Arizona State in the United States of America.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Waist length, Sheep lining

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014005202.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2008, Ani Ashekian last contacted her family. During the time of her disappearance, Ani, a world traveller, was vacationing in Hong Kong, China, with two friends. At some point during her trip, Ani checked out of her hotel room, and made two cash withdrawals from a ATM.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2001, Dawn Rees was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Dawn was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001394.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 2002 Jeremy Crawford was seen for the last time at his residence in Crystal Beach, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls, Ontario on the same date. At the time of his disappearance, Jeremy was despondent.

Case reference: 2020035043.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2020, Jacques Hébert was seen for the last time when he was preparing to go pick blueberries in the forest near his home in Berry, Quebec. Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Upper denture and lower jaw prothesis with implants fixed to metal bar
Pants: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand, work pants
Shirt: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand work shirt
Shoes: Rubber, Black, CROCS style, top cut, camouflage pattern, size 9

Case reference: 2014004157.CaseDesc: Mark Krostewitz was seen for the last time on June 7, 1989 in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2014003808.CaseDesc: On June 10, 1979, Edward McMichael was seen for the last time when he was staying at the YMCA in downtown Vancouver, British-Columbia. He previously travelled to the Yukon and Alberta and worked in the mining industry.

Case reference: 2021019974.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2021, Jason Lambert was reported missing by his family.  Jason was last seen on or about April 16, 2021, departing from a residence in Oliver, British Columbia.  Jason has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014004050.CaseDesc: On Saturday, June 25, 1994, Stephen Tudor was participating in a one man (solo) sailboat race from Port Huron to Mackinac Island.  The sailboat he was sailing, the "ANERIRIN" was located abandoned along the Goderich, Ontario shoreline. Police were unable to locate any signs of Mr. Tudor.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2006021599.CaseDesc: Zbigniew Gajda left Thunder Bay on his snowmobile to go ice fishing on Lake Superior.  He was last seen on January 4, 2001 around Caribou Island Point.  It is thought that his snowmobile may have gone through the ice.

Jacket: Black, Purple and blue on arms

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014006231.CaseDesc: Luis Rodrigues was visiting Canada on a student visa. He was despondent over failing his classes and his visa being expired.

Case reference: 2023002821.CaseDesc: On January 17 2023, Diego Sarria Franco left his residence in Ottawa, Ontario in his 2018 Volkswagon Atlas and did not return home.  Diego's vehicle was located unoccupied in the area of Maple Avenue North in Pembroke Ontario on January 30.

Sweater: Black, HOODIE, Canada Niagara Falls written on the front

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2024022215.CaseDesc: Jacob PENNER was last seen on May 6, 2024, near High Level, Alberta. RCMP are seeking the assistance of the public into information regarding PENNER's whereabouts.

Case reference: 2014006270.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Daniel Pierre was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was driving a rented 2014 black Jeep Grand Cherokee, and was accompanied by his reddish brown, with a white chest, male pit-bull. The vehicle was subsequently located on the corner of Deguire Boulevard and Ashton Street in the Ville Saint-Laurent neighbourhood in Montreal. Daniel is a diabetic and depends on medication that is not in his possession.

Case reference: 2019075539.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2019, Daniel REOCH was last seen in Squamish, British Columbia.  Daniel has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Collared Black long sleeve button up shirt with white buttons
Blue, Black, Collared Blue black plaid long sleeve button up shirt worn over
Blue, Brown, Collared Blue brown tan plaid long sleeve shirt worn underneath
Shoes: Black, White, White trim on soles with white laces on left shoe and black laces on right shoe

Case reference: 2008020999.CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades

Case reference: 2016066066.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2016, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Kevin Dilk was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Kevin has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014002257.CaseDesc: James Clarke was last seen in Kemptville, Ontario on May 10, 1975. At the age of sixteen, James left his mother’s home, and his family have not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014002297.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1983, Dean Martin was seen for the last time at a cottage on Mount Carleton in Carleton-sur-Mer, Quebec. He left the cottage without leaving a note or informing anyone. Dean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2011005499.CaseDesc: Lukas was last seen on October 3, 2011, heading into the bushes behind Chomista Trailer park. His duffle bag was located in the bushes with his personal property on October 7, 2011. He was en route to his sister's place, but never arrived. Lukas has ties to Winnipeg and Calgary.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2018040315.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Joshua Hill was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004813.CaseDesc: Germain Gaudreault was seen for the last time on August 26, 2006, around noon in the area of the municipality of Baie Ste-Catherine, Quebec. He was alone in his 1997 white Plymouth on Highway 138 eastbound. His unoccupied vehicle was found later that evening on the wharf of the municipality of Les Escoumins.

Tattoo: Chest, Blue dot for medical treatments

Case reference: 2014002095.CaseDesc: On May 10, 1980 four men from Grand Forks, North Dakota departed in a boat from the Anama Bay Tourist Camp (Manitoba) for a fishing trip. At approximately 2:45 p.m. on this date an overturned boat was spotted in the Sturgeon Bay area of Lake Winnipeg. The bodies of three of the four men were found. The cause of death for all three of these men was death due to cold exposure (in water) and drowning. The body of William Winters was never recovered. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2021056747.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2021, at approximately 12:45AM, Nivethan Alakeswaran was last seen leaving their residence in Brampton, Ontario. Nivethan's family last heard from him at approximately 7:00AM the same day.  Nivethan has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Navy jacket with brown fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014004578.CaseDesc: Donald Tardif was last seen on August 7, 2003. He fell from his boat, a 14-foot motorboat, on Lake Devenyns in the unorganized territories north of St-Michel-des-Saints. Donald has never been seen since.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Calf, Tibia and fibula fragments

Case reference: 2021037665.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2021 Donald Preston was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia and was last seen on July 31, 2021 in Kersley, British Columbia. It is possible that Donald may have travelled east to New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2014005423.CaseDesc: On January 22, 1971, Maryse Chalette was seen for the last time when she went out for a walk at approximately 12:30 p.m., in the Joliette area in Quebec. Maryse was placed in foster care by the CHRDL Hospital.

Case reference: 2024035450.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2024, the body of this unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River in the United States.

Hair: Black, Bald, Short, Short facial hair, black and grey

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2006020999.CaseDesc: Ivan Matthews was last seen when witnesses saw his sailboat out of control approximately one mile off shore near the Sand Islands in Lake Superior. It is presumed Mr. Matthews fell overboard.  He has not been seen since.

Deformity: Left Foot, club foot, sometimes uses crutches

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2006021099.CaseDesc: Roy Britten was last seen in a 14-foot aluminum boat in the Birch Beach area heading toward the northeast part of Caribou Island, Lake Superior, Ontario.  He is presumed drowned.

Jacket: Blue, Thunder Bay Police Force Association

Case reference: 2014002293.CaseDesc: Gilles Hudon left the town of La Sarre, Quebec on August 20, 1980, in his aunt's car. On September 13, 1980, the car was found on a logging road near Camp 46 of the Abitibi Price logging camp in the Cochrane area of Ontario.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2006018899.CaseDesc: William Bowman was last seen leaving his hunting camp, 83 kilometres north of the Town of Massey, Ontario, at the north end of Hwy.# 810, District Algoma, Monestine Township on October 15, 1979.

Case reference: 2006010599.CaseDesc: William Wabie was last seen as he departed in his 16 foot Starcraft boat from Bag Bay Peninsula, Shoal Lake, near Kenora, Ontario.  Mr. Wabie never arrived at his destination of Cedar Island.

Hat: Straw, Feather on the on side

Case reference: 2002005560.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1975, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Michelle Wedge returned to her residence, but left shortly afterwards. Her bicycle was later located at the intersection of John and Dominion Street, which was not far from her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2005001999.CaseDesc: In September 1979, Norman Ritchie, was a passenger in a 16 foot cedar strip boat on Georgian Bay near Cove Island, when it capsized. Five victims were recovered, but Mr. Ritchie has never been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012003399.CaseDesc: Gregory Porter, 26, was last seen on October 5, 1984, when he was honourably discharged from the army at the Canadian Forces Base in Wainwright, Alberta. He had told people that he was going to British Columbia to drive a taxi. He was in good health both physically and mentally. The initial investigation revealed that Mr. Porter cashed a bank draft for $2400 on October 9, 1984, at a Royal Bank in Edmonton, Alberta. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, lion with wings

Case reference: 2014006123.CaseDesc: Michael Montgomery was last seen at his residence in Mississauga, Ontario on May 22, 2013. At the end of May 2013 Mr. Montgomery was spotted in the area of HWY 16, Jasper National Park, Alberta. It is possible that he was making his way towards Edmonton to look for work.

Case reference: 2021014303.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2013, at approximately 3:56 p.m., Peter Lipinoga was last seen in the area of Terrapin Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Peter was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child

Case reference: 2022057068.CaseDesc: Michael Wry was visiting family in Ontario in 2021 from British Columbia.  Due to Covid travel restrictions he couldn’t leave.  In August of 2022, Michael was supposed to be taking a train back to BC.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall was last seen when he left his residence in the North East area of Jean Cote, Alberta. Patrick had left a note indicating that he would be travelling to Calgary with a friend. The note also indicated that he would be in contact within a few weeks. When he left, Patrick left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2019041758.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2019, Brany Rodriguez was last seen in Waterloo, Ontario.  He was known to lead a transient lifestyle and had previously stayed in all three cities in the Region of Waterloo. His whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014006098.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, Marc Ménard left Quebec to travel to Mexico by car with his dog. When returning home on March 14, 2013, he was denied entry to the United States at the US Customs in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico because his dog was carrying ticks. Therefore, he stayed in Mexico and has not been seen since. His vehicle and his dog were recovered after having been stolen. The individuals interviewed for the vehicle theft provided no information into Marc's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2023055905.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2023, Robert Sam (Whitey) McKEAN was reported missing in Whistler, British Columbia. Robert was walking his dog Lexi, a 15-year-old white and ginger Cavalier, in Whistler's Alpine neighbourhood. Robert and his dog were last seen on video surveillance footage from a neighboring construction site at the end of Alpine Way, where Robert entered the trail but did not exit. Robert was also suffering from dementia, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2010001799.CaseDesc: On the morning of May 18, 1993, Christine Harron stayed home from school as she was not feeling well. Around lunch time Christine and her mother argued about Christine returning to school for the afternoon. Her mother heard Christine leave the house at about 1:30 pm. Christine did not attend school that afternoon and she has not been seen since. The investigation revealed that Christine left the house without her purse, money or knapsack. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Christine Harron, however her remains have yet to be located.

Glasses: Plastic, Brown, Large rimmed with tape

Case reference: 2006015199.CaseDesc: Robert Asher was last seen in Dunnville, Ontario during the winter of 1982. He has not been seen since. Mr. Asher may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance. His vehicle has not been recovered. Mr. Asher was involved with illicit drugs and alcohol at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace with a diamond ring attached

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2001008160.CaseDesc: Jesokah was last seen at approximately 21:30 hours as she was going to take a bus back to the village of Sooke.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)
